article.headline: Boston U. 59, UMBC 53
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Omari Peterkin had 19 points, 14 rebounds and four blocks to lead Boston University to a 59-53 win over the University of Maryland-Baltimore County in America East action Sunday. Tyler Morris added 13 points and Scott Brittain had 10 points and six rebounds for the Terriers (7-11, 4-2 America East), who were trailing for almost the entire game. Mike Housman had 16 points and eight rebounds, Brian Hodges added 11 points and Jay Green chipped in 10 points for the Retrievers (7-13, 3-4 AE.) The Terriers took the lead for good, 49-46, on a 3-pointer by Brian Macon with 3:55 left after Peterkin pulled down a key offensive rebound to keep the Terrier possession alive. BU extended their edge to three points, 51-48, on a lay-up by Peterkin with 1:54 to go. Morris and Brittain combined to go 6-for-6 from the free throw line to secure the win.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
